website_summaries.verdict: A midweight tamper with a slick finish that keeps grounds from sticking.
pros: Resists acids that naturally occur in coffee
Dual ends (50mm and 55mm) fit most portafilter baskets
cons: Manufacturing process may leave slight ridges on the side
Do not put in the dishwasher

customer_reviews.title: Good until you wash it....it’s then dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Washed this with hot water and the entire coating come out. Now some of the coating is rubbing off on my hands. I cannot imagine this is safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: advglobetrottr

customer_reviews.title: Works with the Mr. Coffee Cafe Barista Espresso and Cappuccino Maker
customer_reviews.text: The 50mm size is perfect for the Mr. Coffee BVMC-ECMP1102 Cafe Barista Espresso and Cappuccino Maker. If you are looking for a better puck press, this is the correct size. The large end, then becomes your handle and is good enough to use a few times a day. If you are constantly making coffee, this would not be comfortable in your hand. But it is sooooo much better than the plastic default originally included, especially at $7 delivered.
customer_reviews.author: WatsonIPresume

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tamper
customer_reviews.text: This little tamper is great, it's short, fits in my hand, and is nice to use with my Mr. Coffee espresso machine. Call me lazy but I don't understand washing it - the tamper is used only to tamp down dry coffee grounds which are immediately exposed to steaming hot, if not quite boiling, water that's bound to kill any germs. Why would you put a tamper in the dishwasher?? It doesn't get dirty! I love mine - it does the job and cost the least of any. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Berkshires

customer_reviews.title: NOT stainless steel - made essentially of a high-impact substance similar to plastic
customer_reviews.text: It is not plastic, it's polycarbonate. The picture is deceiving, its placement in search results is deceiving as it is dropped in next to the quality stainless and other metal tampers. Not impressed. The design of item feels good in the hand, however, in its favor. Just wish it had been solid, weighted stainless steel instead of a molded, coated plastic thing.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Person

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy, Excellent Size and Weight, Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought a low-end espresso machine at a deep discount, and it came with a plastic spoon/tamper that I used for 3 months, reluctant to spend a lot of money (as I know making good espresso at home can get very expensive very quickly.) This is an excellent solution to my plastic problem. The smaller end of the tamper fits perfectly, and the size and weight just feel good when pressing down. I have medium-sized girl hands, and I like the how easy it is to apply pressure with my palm on the flat surface versus rounded knobs on other tampers. I was exceptionally pleased with this purchase, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: The 55ml side is a little over 55ml--too big for my machine
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't looking for anything fancy and this isn't. I would be fine with that, but the big side was slightly larger than 55ml and it didn't work with my machine and the 51ml side is a little too small to do a good job without leaving a ring of coffee around the wall. It's also a little roughly cast. You can feel the seam. That said, I would have been happy if it wasn't a little oversized.
customer_reviews.author: Randy R

customer_reviews.title: Everything I've asked for
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a part of my daily making coffee routine for the past 2 months and it's been a very good coffee tamper. It's strong and it get the job done, that's all I needed. For the price it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Huan Cao

customer_reviews.title: Neither one of the 2 sides were the size that I needed but got the job done
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it because I did not know that my espresso machine already came with one but I figured I'd use it anyways since it looks nicer than the 1 the machine came with. But neither one of the 2 sides fits properly but still Gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Emiliooooo!

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We'd been putting off buying one of these, and honestly I don't know why. It fits our Mr. Coffee espresso machine perfectly and works great. Easy to clean, and durable. Love it, and the ramp up it has given our espressos. A must buy if you own a machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sabetha Danes

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I like this double sided tamp. One side fits with my small espresso maker. My only gripe is that there is a bit of room around the edges so I need to make sure that espresso gets pressed as well. It does a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: USCarlos

customer_reviews.title: a must have for the espresso machine
customer_reviews.text: If you have an espresso machine and don't have a tamper, you are not getting the true quality of having any beverage with espresso. The grounds need to be finely ground and packed to properly make espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Maro

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. It’s not very heavy. And it left a metal ring around my hand after using it once. It seems very cheap almost hollow even.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K

customer_reviews.title: Espresso tamper
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy well made piece. I have used it many times and wash it by hand. I have not put it in the dishwasher because I don't want other utensils scratching the finish.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as desired.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing complicated. My only concern was that I would get it and it would be a cheap chintzy piece of @#%$. It is exactly what I hoped for. How often does that happen? ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the tamper for several months now and it is the best accessory that I've bought for my espresso machine. It works exactly as it should--simple and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jinju

customer_reviews.title: Coating comes off
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this! It ended up in the dishwasher. Coating came off and now it’s turning my hands black! I highly doubt this item is safe!
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom who loves to make coffee and she said that using a tamper definitely makes a difference!! I've seen complaints of the metal rubbing off the product when put in the dishwasher, but that shouldn't be a problem if you just hand wash it. I've dropped it on a counter top and on the floor and it didn't break or dent. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine park

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Works well, not sure how the finish will hold up under the long term though. Bit it fits my Mr Coffee espresso machine and meets the need.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heintz

customer_reviews.title: It's metal, slightly ergonomically shaped, and sufficiently tamps ...
customer_reviews.text: It's metal, slightly ergonomically shaped, and sufficiently tamps espresso. I'm giving it 5 stars because that's all it claims to do, and that's all I've attempted thus far. That being said, it would be really hard for any tamper to not get at least 4 starts, I mean it is a piece of metal with to flat ends, one of which you apply weight to press some beans. Price definitely made it worth it
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Simones

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with my Mr. Coffee espresso machine
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to tamp down my espresso grounds before brewing. Works great, and kind of neat looking too!
customer_reviews.author: Lumpy

customer_reviews.title: Swishy washy
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked at the reviews. I had an issue some people had. I hand washed it as soon as I got it. The finish washed off and it left a grey residue on my hands. Now I don't know if I'll use it, probably just take the loss.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: The product turned black after washing with a residue that comes off on my hands and countertop. Definitely not stainless steel. Must be a cheap aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very low quality product. The residual lines on both ...
customer_reviews.text: very low quality product. The residual lines on both sides (from the machine press) are sticking out and scratching the coffee holder (if it even fits your portafilter - because those excess lines are sticking out for a millimeter or so)...
customer_reviews.author: CiPHeR

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the value.
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that this is sturdy and you can compress the coffee easily. Would definitely recommend.

customer_reviews.text: This tamper worked well for my portafilter but after the first time i washed it and it started to smell off. overall you'd be better buying a tamper for a few more bucks.

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a better cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great for tamping down the coffee grinds so we get a better, richer brew from our drip coffee maker.

customer_reviews.text: does the job perfectly. Sure beats the upside down medicine bottle I was using before

customer_reviews.title: Good Tamper
customer_reviews.text: Can't really beat the price on this one. I originally had this one [] for over a year. Accidentally ... it ended up in the dishwasher which ruined the finish (my mistake). I decided to try this one out and it is slightly better. The contoured shaft seems to fit better between fingers when tamping hard. I'm pleased with it. Just have to remember not to let this one get in the dishwasher either...

I have had no issues with any metal flaking - and I clean it with normal dish soap with warm water - and then dry it off right away. Works as expected!

customer_reviews.title: Won't put a "tamper" on your day (hehe)

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not dishwasher safe...

I know this was my fault, but do wish the product would be sturdier than this. I will be looking for a dishwasher safe tamper now.

It was $9 shipped, I knew what I was getting into and would recommend it.

product_meta.title: HIC Dual-Sided Espresso Tamper, 4-Ounce Weight, 50-Millimeter and 55-Millimeter
product_meta.description: Style Name:Espresso TamperHic’s dual-sided espresso tamper compresses ground espresso Coffee into a puck that’s level and dense for a richer, more flavorful espresso brew. Grounds that are too loosely packed allow water to pass through too quickly without extracting any flavor from the Coffee. The dual-sided tamper compresses ground espresso into a densely compacted, evenly dispersed puck. The pressurized water then flows more slowly for the richest, most robust extraction possible. It also creates a necessary gap between the top of the grounds and the water disbursement screen so the dampened grounds don’t Swell to clog The water flow for a silty mess. Dual ends (milliliters and milliliters) fit most portafilter baskets and the 4-ounce weight assists in the tamping process for an effortless preparation. Made from Heavyweight Aluminum, it resists damage caused by the naturally occurring acids found in Coffee. Sturdy and durable. Hand wash in warm, soapy water.
feature_bullets: HIC’s Dual-Sided Espresso Tamper compresses ground espresso coffee into a puck that’s level and dense for a richer, more flavorful espresso brew
Made from heavyweight aluminum; resists damage caused by the naturally occurring acids found in Coffee; strong and durable
Compress ground Espresso into a dense, evenly dispersed puck through which pressurized water flows more slowly for a richer, flavorful extraction
Creates a necessary gap between the top of the grounds and the machine so the dampened grounds don’t Swell and clog the water disbursement screen
Dual ends (50-millimeters and 55-millimeters) fit most portafilter baskets; 4-ounce weight for effortless tamping; hand wash in warm, soapy water
